reviews.text:
A long stretch of straight walking trail with lots to see once you reach the resting spot in-between punggol park or further down the park connector.

Famous resting spot where you see many kids just play within the area sometimes even people fishing. Look down the bridge and you‚Äôll notice lots of fishes, turtles, frogs in the water.

The waters here are like mirror reflecting against the trees! Super pretty sight!
Wide path, long and scenic. Opposite side of the river are all thick foliage and no buildings which gives an untouched nature feel. Serious trash in the river burst that illusion though.
There are a few viewing platform along this pcn, good for sun rise view.  Route ends @ hg ave 7 before defu lane.  Intermediate widening construction is progress.  Toilet & drinking pt are addedüëç

Fav running spot. It leads from Hougang PCN to Serangoon Park Connector (Hougang / Capeview / Upper Serangoon View,Crescent to Defu Industrial/ Tampines Rd) Sungei Serangoon Connector(leads to Punggol Waterway etc) and within Punggol Park (near Hougang ave10/8). On the side Hibiscus Hougang ave 8/10 have to cross a junction leads to another connector to Buangkok/ YCK etc). All paths are connected as the name suggests.
Great place to cycle and jog, especially at night when the air is cool and the sun has set. Not suitable for workouts in the afternoon as there is not much shade available.
